item.title: Creating the animated interact.js logo in SVG and SMIL
item.description: Two of the three animated Δs start at full opacity and fade out while scaling up from 1 to 25 in 10 seconds and from 0 to 15 in 7 seconds. The other fades in and then out while scaling down from 15 to 1 in 13 seconds.

item.title: Simple web demos with livedemo
item.description: takes the text out of highlighted <code> snippets and adds elements and CSS to the DOM and executes JS code.

item.title: A guide to SVG <use> elements
item.description: SVG <use> elements allow you to duplicate and re-use graphical SVG elements including <g>, <svg> and <symbol> elements as well as other <use> elements. With them, you can craft SVG documents with a DRY kind of approach.

item.title: How to control what is copy-pasted to/from the clipboard in Chrome, Firefox and Safari
item.description: control what the browser copies and pastes when a user uses keyboard shortcuts or the right-click context menu by changing focus to an element of your choice

item.title: Hey web-devs, stop listening for EITHER touch or mouse events!
item.description: Seriously. It's annoying. Some devices have a touchscreen and mouse/trackpad.

item.title: Path snapping in interact.js
item.description: path snapping now lets you set fixed axis origin points or use functions to return the points that the pointer should snap to.
